questionText: What is an input operation in programming?
options: The process of saving data to a file
The process of a program receiving data from an external source
The process of displaying results on the screen
The process of performing mathematical calculations

questionText: Which function in the C language is used to output text to the console?
What happens if a user enters letters instead of a number in a program using scanf("%d", &age)?
options: The program will automatically convert the letters to a number
The program will terminate with a compilation error
The age variable will remain unchanged, and the program's behavior becomes unpredictable
The program will print an error message and ask for input again

questionText: Which of the following devices are INPUT devices? (Select all that apply)
Which symbol is used in the printf() function to substitute an integer?
Which library must be included to use the printf and scanf functions?
What does the & operator before a variable name do in the scanf function?
options: Specifies the memory address where the variable is stored
Compares the variable's value to zero

questionText: Write the command to print an integer variable named age.
What is the "standard output stream" (stdout) in C?
options: The stream for reading data from the user
The stream for outputting program errors
The default stream for outputting normal program messages
The stream for writing data to a file

questionText: What is the error in this line of code? scanf("%d", age);
options: Missing ampersand & before the variable age
The scanf function cannot be used for number input
